body:
## Contribution Flow - Sessions 1, 2A, 2B, 2C

Implemented shareable contribution links allowing contributors to add voice recordings without authentication.

### Backend Changes

**Database (Session 1)**
- Added `ShareCodeIndex` GSI to DynamoDB for fast code lookups
- Created `backend/src/db/shareCodes.js` with share code CRUD operations
- Schema: 8-character codes with permissions and active status

**API Routes (Session 2A)**
- Created `backend/src/handlers/shareCodeHandler.js` with 4 endpoints:
  - `POST /api/projects/:projectId/share-codes` - Generate share code (authenticated)
  - `GET /api/share-codes/:code/validate` - Validate code (public)
  - `GET /api/projects/:projectId/share-codes` - List codes (authenticated)
  - `DELETE /api/share-codes/:code` - Deactivate code (authenticated)
- Added public endpoints for contributor access:
  - `GET /api/public/photos/:id`
  - `GET /api/public/recordings`
  - `POST /api/public/recordings` (accepts contributorName)

### Frontend Changes

**Contribution Flow (Session 2B)**
- Created `ContributorNamePrompt.tsx` - Captures contributor name on first visit (localStorage)
- Created `ContributePhoto.tsx` - Public page for recording memories
  - Route: `/contribute/:shareCode/photo/:photoId` (no auth required)
  - Validates share code and displays photo
  - Lists existing recordings with playback
  - Inline voice recorder (30-second limit)
  - Mobile-first design with large touch targets
- Added public API functions to `utils/api.ts`

**Host UI (Session 2C)**
- Added share link generation to `ProjectDashboard.tsx`
- Created `ShareLinkModal.tsx` - Copy-to-clipboard modal with QR code
- Share button on each photo for easy link generation

### Key Features
âœ… No authentication required for contributors
âœ… Share codes with GSI for fast validation
âœ… Contributor names stored with recordings
âœ… Mobile-optimized recording interface
âœ… One-click share link generation for hosts
âœ… QR codes for easy mobile sharing

### Testing
Visit `/contribute/:shareCode/photo/:photoId` to test the contribution flow.
Generate share links from the project dashboard "Share" buttons.
title: Feature/contribution flow

commits.messageBody:
Session 1 - Part 1 & 2: Share code database layer

Infrastructure:
- Added ShareCodeIndex GSI to DynamoDB table for querying by code
- GSI uses 'code' attribute as partition key with PAY_PER_REQUEST billing

Database Helper (backend/src/db/shareCodes.js):
- generateShareCode() - Creates 8-character alphanumeric codes
- createShareCode() - Stores share codes in DynamoDB
- getShareCodeByCode() - Queries using ShareCodeIndex GSI
- validateShareCode() - Validates active codes, returns project info
- getShareCodesByProject() - Gets all codes for a project
- deactivateShareCode() - Marks code as inactive
- deleteShareCode() - Removes code from database

Share Code Schema:
- PK: PROJECT#<projectId>
- SK: SHARE#<code>
- Attributes: code, projectId, createdBy, createdAt, permissions[], active

Testing:
- Added comprehensive test script (test-share-codes.js)
- All 9 test cases passing successfully

Next: API routes for share code management

API Endpoints:
1. POST /api/projects/:projectId/share-codes (auth required)
   - Creates share code for project
   - Returns code and shareable URL
   - Verifies user owns project

2. GET /api/share-codes/:code/validate (public, no auth)

   - Returns project info and permissions
   - Used by contributors to access projects

3. GET /api/projects/:projectId/share-codes (auth required)
   - Lists all share codes for project
   - Includes share URLs and metadata

4. DELETE /api/share-codes/:code (auth required)
   - Deactivates share code
   - Verifies user owns project

Handler Implementation (backend/src/handlers/shareCodeHandler.js):
- Follows existing handler patterns
- Uses success/error response helpers
- Includes proper auth checks and validation
- Generates share URLs using FRONTEND_URL env var

Integration:

- Lambda automatically picks up routes via serverless-http
- Added FRONTEND_URL to .env (https://localhost:5173)

Testing:
- Created test-api-setup.js for creating test data
- Created SHARE_CODE_API_TESTING.md with examples
- Validated public endpoint works correctly
- Returns proper 404 for invalid codes

Environment:
- FRONTEND_URL added to backend/.env (not committed)
- TODO: Add FRONTEND_URL to serverless.yml for Lambda deployment

Next: Frontend contribution page and mobile-optimized recorder

commits.messageBody:
Two critical fixes for EC2 video processor auto-stop:

1. IAM Permissions (CRITICAL)
   - Added ec2:StopInstances permission to IAM role
   - Added ec2:DescribeInstances for status checks
   - Scoped to instances with Name tag 'loomed-memories-video-processor'
   - Auto-stop was failing every 5 minutes for 8+ hours due to missing permission

2. Spot Instance Type (one-time â†’ persistent)
   - Changed from 'one-time' to 'persistent' Spot requests
   - Changed InstanceInterruptionBehavior from 'terminate' to 'stop'
   - One-time instances can only be terminated (not stopped/started)
   - Persistent instances can be stopped/started for auto-scaling

Issue Analysis:
- Auto-stop mechanism WAS working correctly
- Detected 5 minutes idle and attempted shutdown
- Failed with: "UnauthorizedOperation: not authorized to perform: ec2:StopInstances"
- Service restarted automatically every 10 seconds (systemd)
- Resulted in infinite retry loop for 8+ hours

Resolution:
- Updated IAM policy with EC2 permissions
- Terminated problematic one-time instance
- Updated launch script for future persistent instances

Next instance will:
- Auto-stop after 5 minutes idle
- Be stoppable/startable manually from console
- Cost ~$0.04/hour only when running

- Input validation for photos and audio files
- Video quality verification (resolution, fps, codec)
- Edge case handling (0 photos, 1 photo)
- Proper temp file cleanup

Updated docs (CLAUDE.md, progress.md, README.md) with:
- Parallel FFmpeg architecture
- Performance benchmarks
- Session 2-5 implementation details

body:
Adds automatic face detection using AWS Rekognition to improve video Ken Burns effects. When photos are uploaded, detected faces are used to calculate a focus point that centers the zoom/pan effect on people.

Architecture:
- S3 trigger fires Lambda on photo uploads (photos/ prefix)
- Lambda calls Rekognition DetectFaces API
- Focus point = centroid of all detected faces
- faceData stored in DynamoDB photo record
- Video generation uses focus point as Ken Burns anchor

S3 Key Format Migration:
- Old: photos/{timestamp}-{filename}
- New: photos/{projectId}/{photoId}/{filename}
- Enables Lambda to parse IDs directly for DynamoDB lookup
- Migration script: npm run migrate-storage
- Backfill script: npm run backfill-faces

Files changed:
- backend/src/faceDetection.js - New Lambda handler
- backend/src/shared/storage.js - New S3 key format
- backend/src/photoHandler.js - Generate photoId early
- backend/src/db/photos.js - generatePhotoId(), updatePhotoFaceData()
- backend/serverless.yml - Lambda + S3 trigger + Rekognition perms
- processing/src/video/effects.py - get_focus_point(), focus_point param
- processing/src/video/models.py - focus_point in PhotoInfo
- processing/src/process_queue.py - Extract faceData from photos

body:
Face detection improvements:
- Smart face selection: filters background faces (<25% of largest)
- Group photos use centroid, single subjects use their face
- Adaptive zoom (5-20%) based on face bounds to avoid cutting faces
- Subpixel precision with cv2.warpAffine eliminates jitter
- Portrait photos: square crop with pillarbox transitioning to 16:9

Backend updates:
- Updated videoHandler resolution handling
- Photo handler improvements
- Face data stored in DynamoDB photo records

Documentation:
- Updated README with face detection pipeline, on-demand EC2 (c6i.2xlarge)
- Updated CLAUDE.md and progress.md with implementation details
- Added faceDetection Lambda and Rekognition to AWS resources

title: Feature/memories

commits.messageBody:
Major refactor replacing the "Groups" concept with "Memories" - a recording
attached to 1-5 photos that plays while those photos display in the video.

Data Model Changes:
- New Memory entity with status (pending/complete), photoIds, recording fields
- Recordings now tied to Memories instead of individual photos
- Photos have inVideo boolean instead of groupId
- Contributors auto-create Memory when recording via share code

New Dashboard Tabs:
- Photo Library: Grid view with filters (All/In Video/Not in Video), bulk actions
- Video Builder: Timeline view with drag-drop reordering, memory detail panel
- Add Photos to Memory modal for expanding memories (up to 5 photos)

Contributor Flows:
- Flow 1: Browse and Record - General share link, pick a photo, record
- Flow 2: Share Specific Photos - Host shares 1-5 photos as pending memory,
  contributor records slideshow with auto-cycling photos (5s each)
- Flow 3: Upload Photo + Record - Contributor uploads, auto-navigates to record

New Components:
- PhotoLibrary.tsx - Photo management with selection and bulk actions
- VideoBuilder.tsx - Timeline editor with dnd-kit drag-drop
- ContributeMemory.tsx - Slideshow recording with volume analysis
- SharePhotosModal.tsx - Create pending memory with share link
- AddPhotosToMemoryModal.tsx - Add photos to existing memory

Volume Analysis Features:
- Post-recording peak/RMS volume calculation
- Volume feedback (good/quiet/loud) with "Use Anyway" option
- Real-time 7-bar equalizer visualization during playback

Migration:
- backend/scripts/migrate-to-memories.js for converting legacy data

Deleted (replaced by Memories):
- Groups: db/groups.js, handlers/groupHandler.js, api/groups.ts
- Pages: GroupDetail.tsx, ContributeGroup.tsx
- Components: GroupedPhotoCard.tsx

- Eliminates "start, move, stop" feel during transitions

Video Processing:
- New timeline.py module for authoritative timing calculations
- Draft memories correctly handled (no ducking when no narration)
- Improved debug logging for timing verification

Frontend:
- Music timeline modal with waveform visualization
- Track selection and section assignment
- Generate video modal shows selected music tracks

â€¦igned uploads

AI Producer:
- Two-stage Gemini AI pipeline for automatic video curation
- Stage 1: Batched quality filtering for large photo sets (300+)
  - Downloads photos once at 1024px, resizes per batch
  - Asks for REJECTED photos (smaller output)
  - Iterates until â‰¤150 photos for Stage 2
- Stage 2: Chronological analysis, sections, memory groups
- ProjectPerson entity for "people to recognize" with reference photos
- AIProducerModal with 4-step workflow (configure, process, preview, apply)
- Recording prompts generated per memory group

Project Settings:
- ProjectSettingsModal accessible via gear icon
- Story field replaces description (context for AI)
- Manage people (honorees/featured/included)
- PUT /api/projects/:id endpoint

Pre-signed S3 Uploads:
- 3-step flow bypasses Lambda 6MB limit
- Supports uploads up to 100MB
- Works for both authenticated and share code uploads

Photo Thumbnails:
- 200x200px JPEG thumbnails generated on upload
- Improves grid performance for large photo collections

Sharp Cross-Platform Fix:
- Automatic linux binary install for Lambda deployment

Major changes:

AI Producer Pre-Upload:
- Photos now upload to Gemini Files API during async processing (eliminates wait time)
- Stores gemini_file_uri, gemini_file_name, gemini_file_expires on photo records
- Setup stage checks file status, triggers background re-upload if expired
- New UploadStatus component shows preparation progress

Face Identification:
- Fixed duplicate person identification for same face
- Now tracks matches by faceId, keeping only highest-confidence person per face
- Prevents confusing "Nina (100%), Rebecca (75%)" for same face

Stage Fixes:
- Removed explicit Upload stage from UI - goes Setup â†’ Identify directly
- Filter/Chronology stages build uploadedFiles from photo records
- Chronology deduplicates photo IDs (backend and frontend)
- Changed all stages to use gemini-2.5-flash (not flash-lite)

Performance:
- Projects list: Added getPhotoCountAndFirst() for efficient count + thumbnail
- Fixed N+1 query problem - single request instead of 21

- Updated README.md AI Producer section and component list
- Added AI_PRODUCER.md to documentation links

title: Feature/photo enhancement

commits.messageBody:
Phase 2 of photo enhancement pipeline:

**GCS Storage:**
- Photos uploaded to gs://kindred-reels-photos-dev for AI features
- New fields: gcsUri, gcsBucket, gcsPath stored on photo records

**Gemini 3 Flash Analysis:**
- Face detection with bounding boxes (replaces Rekognition DetectFaces)
- Restoration score (0-100) indicating restoration need
- Quality issues detection (faded, scratched, grainy, etc.)
- Orientation detection (0, 90, 180, 270 degrees)
- Estimated decade and color/B&W detection
- Content blocking detection for safety
- Falls back to Rekognition if Gemini fails

**Lambda Package Optimization:**
- Added serverless-esbuild for bundling (260MB â†’ 4.8MB)
- ESM output format for import.meta.url support
- Sharp moved to Lambda Layer
- Simplified deploy scripts (no more sharp:linux swap)

**New Lambda Layer:**
- pillow-heif-gcs-layer:2 with google-cloud-storage + google-generativeai
- build-python-layer.sh script for rebuilding

**Schema Updates:**
- geminiAnalysis field for full Gemini response
- contentBlocked, contentBlockReason fields
- GCS storage path fields

body:
Fixes API Gateway 30-second timeout for long-running AI Producer stages by moving filter, chronology, and finalize stages to async worker Lambda.

Backend changes:
- New aiProducerWorker Lambda with 15-minute timeout
- API handlers invoke worker async and return immediately
- New session statuses: filter_processing, filtered, chronology_processing, sorted, finalize_processing, finalized
- Error fields: filterError, chronologyError, finalizeError
- Local dev uses setImmediate to run worker in background

Frontend changes:
- FilterStage, SortStage, OrganizeStage poll every 3s during processing
- StageProgress maps new statuses to correct stage indices
- AIProducerPage renders components for processing/completed statuses
- New TypeScript types for async statuses and error fields

Also adds Git Workflow section to CLAUDE.md (pull before push).

body:
Complete overhaul of VideoBuilder state management and drag-and-drop:

Stage 1: Eliminate standalone photos - migration script converts to 1-photo memories
Stage 2: Remove photo from group sends to Photo Library (not timeline)
Stage 3: Optimistic updates eliminate full timeline reloads
Stage 4: Drag photos between groups within same section
Stage 5: Drag photos to section tabs to move across sections
Stage 6: Photo Library multi-select creates grouped memory (max 5 photos)

Key changes:
- Single source of truth: itemsBySection derived from localItems via useMemo
- Atomic photo moves via new PUT /memories/move-photo endpoint
- Optimistic updates for instant UI feedback
- Section tabs accept drops to move items across sections
- "Add to Video" now creates draft memory instead of individual photos
title: feat: Timeline UX improvements (Stages 1-6)

commits.messageBody:
The deploy script was hardcoded to use dev SQS queue, S3 buckets, and
DynamoDB table. This caused prod video processing to fail because the
EC2 processor was looking at the wrong resources.

- Add --stage=dev|prod parameter (defaults to dev)
- Configure S3_UPLOADS_BUCKET, S3_VIDEOS_BUCKET, DYNAMODB_TABLE_NAME per stage
- Update usage instructions

Usage: npm run deploy-ec2 <instance-id> --stage=prod

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.messageHeadline: fix: Add --stage support to EC2 deploy script for prod/dev

commits.messageBody:
Multiple section title slides were using the same 'slide_silent_audio.aac'
temp filename during parallel rendering, causing "End of file" errors when
one process overwrote another's audio file.

- Use UUID-based unique filename for each silent audio file
- Add error handling if create_silent_audio fails
- Clean up temp audio files after use

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.messageHeadline: fix: Race condition in parallel section title rendering

commits.messageBody:
The browser singleton was created in the main process but child workers
inherited the reference without a valid event loop, causing
"no running event loop" errors when rendering section title slides.

- Track process ID that created the browser
- Reinitialize browser when detected in a different process
- Only close browser from the process that created it

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.messageHeadline: fix: Playwright browser not fork-safe in multiprocessing workers

body:
Previously GitHub Actions and local script used incompatible structures:
- GitHub Actions: ~/video-processor/*.py (flat), ~/templates/, ~/fonts/
- Local script: ~/video-processor/src/*.py, ~/video-processor/templates/

This caused stale code issues when switching between deployment methods.

Changes:
- All methods now use package-based structure (src/ subdirectory)
- Templates and fonts stored inside video-processor directory
- Added cleanup step to remove old structures and __pycache__
- Updated systemd ExecStart to use src/ec2_handler.py path
title: fix: Unify EC2 deployment structure across all methods

commits.messageBody:
Previously GitHub Actions and local script used incompatible structures:
- GitHub Actions: ~/video-processor/*.py (flat), ~/templates/, ~/fonts/
- Local script: ~/video-processor/src/*.py, ~/video-processor/templates/

This caused stale code issues when switching between deployment methods.

Changes:
- All methods now use package-based structure (src/ subdirectory)
- Templates and fonts stored inside video-processor directory
- Added cleanup step to remove old structures and __pycache__
- Updated systemd ExecStart to use src/ec2_handler.py path

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

body:
- Changed PROD EC2 instance from c6i.2xlarge (8 vCPU, 16GB) to m6i.4xlarge (16 vCPU, 64GB)

commits.messageBody:
Event projects can now create timelines with AI-powered photo organization:

## Frontend
- CreateTimelineModal: Questions modal for video length, voice memories, apply mode
- OrganizationModeView: Full-screen review/edit UI with drag-and-drop
- ProcessingStatusBar: Shows photo processing progress in Photos tab
- ProcessingDetailsModal: Detailed status with failed photo info
- Add Photos mode in VideoBuilder for post-creation editing
- Optimistic updates for drag operations with rollback on error

## Backend
- eventOrganizerHandler: API endpoints for organization drafts
- eventOrganizer service: Gemini-powered photo filtering and curation
- organizationDrafts.js: DynamoDB operations for draft storage
- importJobs.js: Google Photos import job tracking
- googlePhotosImportWorker: Async Lambda for photo imports
- Real-time progress tracking during AI processing

## Video Processing
- Per-section beat sync: Each section analyzes its own music
- Concat-based audio mixing (fixes QuickTime playback issues)
- Music ends when section content ends
- Beat sync minimum duration enforcement (2.5s fallback)

## Google Photos
- Token refresh and reconnection handling
- Async import with progress polling
- Video filtering (skip unsupported formats)

## Other
- Lambda timeout increases (imageProcessor 180s, photoProcessingWorker 240s)
- Persist AI exclusion reasons on photos after timeline creation
- Removed obsolete plan docs (consolidated into FLOWS.md)

body:
â€¦o spinners

Converted the Replace mutation from pessimistic (~7s spinners) to optimistic (instant visual swap). Moved cache swap from async onMutate into the handler so it batches with exclusion updates and lightbox context change in a single React render, eliminating a double-flash caused by the two-render timing gap. Removed snapshot machinery (replacingSnapshotRef, stableCluster, isReplacing state) from OrganizationLightbox. Error rollback restores both video-builder cache and session exclusions.

Also includes frontend state refactoring: extracted useOrganizationMode hook, simplified mutation hooks, and moved org-mode state out of VideoBuilder.
